explanation: The asserted strlen(token) is inside mhd_assert, and mhd_assert is defined as a no-op ((void)0) in the provided code, so there is no actual call to strlen in the compiled function. Therefore no <string.h> function is invoked here and no out‑of‑bounds access caused by strlen occurs in the shown build. (If mhd_assert were enabled in other build configurations, the strlen could indeed read past token if the caller did not supply a NUL within token_len — in that configuration a violation would be possible. To be robust, use an explicit bounded check or strnlen in enabled-assert builds.)
